title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC user, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the installer, when I run it and accept all defaults, then the game installs to the default directory and a completion screen appears.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the target drive has less than 2 GB of free space, when I click 'Install', then the installer displays an 'insufficient disk space' error and halts the installation.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a standard user, when I run the installer, then a Windows User Account Control (UAC) prompt appears requesting administrative privileges to proceed.
definition_of_done: Code (Inno Setup script) reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met on target OS versions. Final installer is a single, self-contained .exe file. QA has confirmed the installed game launches and is playable.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a valid directory on a different drive and proceeds, then the game files are installed into the chosen directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a drive, then the UI accurately displays the required and available disk space for that drive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user selects a directory on a drive with insufficient space, when they attempt to proceed, then the installer displays an error and disables the 'Next' button.
definition_of_done: Code (Inno Setup script) reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The installer correctly handles default and custom paths. The uninstaller is aware of the custom path.

title: Create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player, I want a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during installation so that I can easily launch the game from my desktop.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the 'Select Additional Tasks' screen, when the user leaves the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option checked by default and completes installation, then a shortcut is created on the desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a desktop shortcut was created, when the user double-clicks it, then the Monopoly Tycoon game launches successfully.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Select Additional Tasks' screen, when the user unchecks the shortcut option and completes installation, then no shortcut is created on the desktop.
definition_of_done: Code (Inno Setup script) reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The shortcut has the correct icon, name, and target path.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an unhandled exception occurs, when the global exception handler catches it, then a modal error dialog is displayed to the user.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views it, then it contains a non-technical message, a unique Error ID, and the full path to the log directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an unhandled exception is caught, when it is processed by the logging system, then an 'ERROR' level log entry is written to the log file containing the full exception details and the same Error ID shown to the user.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The handler catches exceptions from different parts of the application. The error dialog UI is clear and functional.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed, when the user initiates the uninstallation from 'Apps & features' and confirms, then all application files, shortcuts, and Start Menu entries are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Monopoly Tycoon game is currently running, when the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, then the uninstaller displays an error message stating the game must be closed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is a standard (non-admin) user, when the uninstallation is initiated, then a UAC prompt appears requesting administrator credentials.
definition_of_done: Code (Inno Setup script) reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The uninstaller removes all application files and registry keys, leaving no artifacts.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a user uninstalling the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (save files, profile) so that I can reinstall later without losing my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user runs the uninstaller, when they select 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files are removed but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory remains.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user runs the uninstaller, when they select 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is installed but has never been run (no personal data exists), when the user runs the uninstaller, then it completes without presenting the prompt to remove personal data.
definition_of_done: Code (Inno Setup script) reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The conditional deletion logic is tested and verified.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu, when the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and activates it, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the main menu, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transition between scenes is smooth and completes in under 1 second.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge and duration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '3' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of four players: one human and three AIs.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am interacting with the UI for selecting opponents, when I view the available options, then the only selectable choices are '1', '2', and '3'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The UI correctly reflects the selection, and the game starts with the correct number of players.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have selected 3 AI opponents, when I set their difficulties to 'Easy', 'Hard', and 'Medium' respectively, then the UI clearly displays these selections for each AI.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I add a new AI opponent, then its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured a game with specific difficulties, when I start the game, then the internal PlayerState objects for the AIs are initialized with the correct 'ai_difficulty' properties.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. Selected difficulties are correctly passed to the game state upon starting a new game.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
description: As a player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name so that my game progress and statistics are saved under my unique identity.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a valid name (3-16 alphanumeric characters) and starts the game, then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', when the game starts, then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the game HUD.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player enters a name with leading/trailing spaces (e.g., '  RailroadMogul  '), when they proceed, then the system trims the whitespace and saves the name as 'RailroadMogul'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The profile is correctly saved to the SQLite database and used in-game.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid so that I can easily correct it and proceed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters, then an error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed and the proceed button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the profile name input field, when the player enters a name containing special characters, then an error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed and the proceed button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is displayed, when the player edits the name to be valid, then the error message disappears and the proceed button becomes enabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. Validation logic executes in real-time as the user types, providing immediate feedback.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games so that I can track my performance and long-term progression.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has completed at least one game, when they select 'Player Statistics' from the main menu, then the screen correctly shows aggregated values for Total games played, Total wins, Win/Loss ratio, etc.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when they navigate to the statistics screen, then the screen displays all categories with default 'zero-state' values (e.g., '0', 'N/A').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has existing stats with 5 games played and 2 wins, when the player completes and wins a new game, then the 'Total Games Played' statistic updates to '6' and 'Total Wins' updates to '3'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The screen loads in under 1 second. The database backup and recovery mechanism is functional.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens so that I can personalize my in-game identity.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token from the selection interface, then the token becomes visually highlighted and a preview is shown.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AIs are each assigned a unique token from the remaining pool.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during setup, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board is the 'Battleship'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. A minimum of 8 token options are available. The selection is correctly reflected in-game.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice so that I can determine how many spaces my token will move.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the system generates two random integers between 1 and 6 and the game transitions to the 'Movement Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn, when the game state is updated, then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive for the human player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant', when the player clicks 'Roll Dice', then the dice roll animation is skipped entirely and the result is displayed before the token moves.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The dice roll uses a cryptographically secure random number generator as specified.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice so that I can visually track my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's token is on space 11 and they roll a 5, when the dice roll is complete, then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces to land on space 16.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player's token is on space 37 and they roll a 6, when the dice roll is complete, then the token animates moving sequentially, clearly passing over the 'GO' space before landing on space 5.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, when the game logic directs them to Jail, then the token plays a special, direct animation from its current space to the 'In Jail' section of the board.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The animation is smooth and does not drop the frame rate below 45 FPS on recommended hardware.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a player, I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, when the player rolls doubles, then they move, complete their action, and the game state confirms it is still their turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has just rolled doubles, when they roll again on their extra turn and the result is NOT a double, then they move, complete their action, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in jail and rolls doubles to get out, when they move and complete their action, then their turn ends and they are NOT granted an extra turn.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The game correctly tracks consecutive doubles and handles the 'get out of jail' exception.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn so that the game correctly enforces the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when they roll for a third time and the result is doubles, then their token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO, when they roll their third consecutive double, then their token is sent directly to Jail and does NOT collect the $200 GO salary.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has rolled doubles consecutively, when their next roll in the same turn is not doubles, then they move normally, their turn ends, and their consecutive doubles counter is reset to zero.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The system provides clear visual and audio feedback for the event.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary when I land on or pass over the GO space so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with $500 cash, when the player rolls a 5 and lands on 'Baltic Avenue' (space 3), then their cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with $500 cash, when the player rolls a 3 and lands exactly on 'GO' (space 0), then their cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player draws a 'Go to Jail' card, when their token moves to the Jail space, then their cash balance remains unchanged and they do not collect a GO salary.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is logged at INFO level. Clear visual and audio feedback is provided.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a player in jail, I want the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn so that I can get out immediately and continue my turn normally.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $1500, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $1450, my status becomes 'Active', and I proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $49, when the 'Get Out of Jail' options are presented, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with exactly $50 cash, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $0 and I proceed with my turn.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is atomic and correctly updates the PlayerState.

title: Use a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a player in jail with a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to use it at the start of my turn so that I can get out immediately without spending money.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given my status is 'InJail' and my 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, when I select 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', then my status becomes 'Active', my card count becomes 0, and I proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I use a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card that originated from the Chance deck, when the action is confirmed, then the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given my status is 'InJail' and my 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, when my turn begins, then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The card is correctly returned to the bottom of its original deck.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in jail, when I select 'Roll for Doubles' and the result is doubles, then my status is updated to 'Active' and I move forward the number of spaces shown, but my turn ends (no extra turn).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in jail with 3 turns remaining, when I select 'Roll for Doubles' and the result is not doubles, then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the jail action menu is displayed with multiple options, when I click 'Roll for Doubles', then all other options in the menu become disabled and the dice roll sequence is initiated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The special 'no extra turn' rule is correctly enforced.

title: Be forced to pay the jail fine after 3 failed rolls
description: As a player in jail for my third turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles so that the official game rules are enforced.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in jail, their 'jail_turns_remaining' is 1, and they have >$50 cash, when they roll and the result is not doubles, then their cash is reduced by $50, their status becomes 'Active', and they move the number of spaces shown.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in jail on their 3rd turn, when they roll and the result IS doubles, then their cash is not changed, their status becomes 'Active', and they move the number of spaces shown.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in jail on their 3rd turn with <$50 cash, when they roll and fail, then the game is paused and the player is prompted to raise funds to cover the $50 debt before their turn can proceed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. Integration with the asset liquidation and bankruptcy systems is fully tested.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when I land on a Chance space so that the game follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on a Chance space and the top card is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', when the card is drawn, then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash becomes $50 richer, and the card is placed at the bottom of the deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on a Chance space, when they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then the player's card count becomes 1 and this specific card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has $10 cash, when they draw the 'Pay poor tax of $15' card, then the system determines the player cannot pay and the bankruptcy process is initiated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. All 16 standard Chance cards are implemented and tested. Card data is loaded from an external JSON file.

title: Draw a Community Chest card
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card when I land on that space so that the game follows official rules and introduces random events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on Community Chest and draws 'Bank error in your favor. Collect $200', when the card is drawn, then the player's cash balance is increased by $200 and the card is returned to the bottom of the deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, then their card count is incremented and the card is removed from the deck until used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw 'It is your birthday. Collect $10 from every player', then the active player's cash increases by $10 for each opponent, and each opponent's cash decreases by $10.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. All 16 standard Community Chest cards are implemented and tested. Card data is loaded from an external JSON file.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% for Income Tax
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on Income Tax so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a human player lands on 'Income Tax', when their movement ends, then the game pauses and a modal dialog is displayed with the two payment options.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has $500 cash and $1500 in assets (total net worth $2000), when the Income Tax dialog is displayed, then it presents the options '$200' and '10% ($200)'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has $100 cash and a net worth of $1500, when they select either the '$200' or '$150' option, then the game initiates the asset liquidation flow to cover the debt.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The net worth calculation is accurate and includes cash, printed property values, and building costs.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player with sufficient funds lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, when their movement ends, then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from their cash balance.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player with insufficient cash lands on 'Luxury Tax', when their movement ends, then the game flow is paused and the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player cannot raise enough funds to pay the Luxury Tax, when they fail to cover the debt, then the player is declared bankrupt to the Bank.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is logged at INFO level. Integration with the bankruptcy system is verified.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on the 'Free Parking' space without rolling doubles, when their movement concludes, then their cash balance remains unchanged and the turn proceeds to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on the 'Free Parking' space after rolling doubles, when their movement concludes, then their cash balance remains unchanged and the game prompts them to take their extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is on a space before GO, when they roll a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', then their cash balance increases by $200 for passing GO, and the Free Parking space has no further effect.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The 'no house rules' implementation is verified for this space.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of the human player's turn, when control is passed to the player, then the game enters a 'Pre-Roll Management Phase' and waits for the player to click the 'Roll Dice' button.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player successfully builds a house and then clicks 'Roll Dice', then the game state is updated with the new house before the dice roll is initiated.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, when the game grants an extra turn, then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase' before the next roll.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The TurnManager state machine correctly handles this phase, including for doubles and jail scenarios.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price so that I can strategically acquire assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am a human player with $1000 cash, when my token lands on the unowned 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then a modal dialog appears with options to 'Buy' or 'Auction'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the buy prompt is displayed, when I click the 'Buy' button, then my cash is reduced by $140, 'St. Charles Place' is added to my property list, and the ownership indicator on the board updates to my color.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am a human player with $100 cash, when my token lands on 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), then the purchase dialog is displayed but the 'Buy' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is atomic and correctly updates the GameState and UI.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction
description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on to trigger an auction, allowing me to acquire it for a lower price or force others to spend cash.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the purchase decision dialog for an unowned property is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the dialog closes and the auction process begins for that property.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have landed on an unowned property I cannot afford, when the purchase dialog appears, then the 'Buy' button is disabled but the 'Auction' button remains enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the purchase decision dialog is displayed, when I attempt to click any UI element outside the dialog, then the interaction has no effect and the dialog remains in focus.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The story correctly triggers the auction system defined in US-032.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress and it's my turn to bid, when I place a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, then the bid amount is deducted from my cash and the property is added to my portfolio.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress and it's my turn to bid, when I select the 'Withdraw' option, then my bidding controls are disabled and the turn passes to the next active bidder.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the current high bid is $200 and I have $205 cash, when my turn to bid arrives and the minimum next bid is $206, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled, leaving 'Withdraw' as my only option.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The auction follows the correct clockwise bidding order and correctly identifies the winner.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own all Light Blue properties, they are unmortgaged, and I have at least $50, when I choose to build one house on Oriental Avenue, then my cash is reduced by $50 and a house appears on the Oriental Avenue space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own Oriental Avenue but not the complete Light Blue set, when I access the property management screen, then the option to build houses on Oriental Avenue is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own the Light Blue monopoly but have only $49 cash, when I attempt to build a house (cost $50), then the action is blocked and a notification states 'Insufficient Funds'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The build action is validated against all game rules (monopoly, funds, bank supply, mortgage status).

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a player, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses so that the game is fair and follows official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house and Properties B and C have 0, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked and the UI provides feedback.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, when I attempt to build a second house on any property in that set, then the transaction is successful.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses and Properties B and C have 2, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B, then the action is blocked and the UI indicates I must sell from Property A first.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The rule is correctly enforced for both building and selling houses and hotels.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
description: As a player who has developed a monopoly with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where every property has 4 houses and I have sufficient cash, when I initiate the 'Build Hotel' action, then my cash is reduced, the bank's hotel count decreases by 1, its house count increases by 4, and the property visually updates to 1 hotel.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where one property has 4 houses but another has only 3, when I view the property management UI, then the option to build a hotel is disabled for all properties in that set.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am eligible to build a hotel but the bank has no hotels left, when I attempt to purchase a hotel, then the transaction is blocked and a UI notification informs me of the hotel shortage.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The hotel transaction is atomic and correctly updates all relevant parts of the GameState.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
description: As a player, I want to receive a clear notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Property Management screen, when I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, then the purchase is prevented and a notification appears stating 'No houses available in the bank'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, when I view my properties in the Property Management interface, then the 'Build House' buttons for all eligible properties are visually disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's house supply was 0, when another player sells houses back to the bank, then on my next turn the 'Build House' buttons in my interface become enabled again.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The UI state correctly reflects the bank's inventory in real-time.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage so that I have a fair chance to acquire these critical assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the Bank has only 2 houses left and multiple players wish to build, when a player attempts to build, then a building auction is initiated for the available houses, one at a time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a building auction is active, when it is the Human Player's turn to bid, then the UI clearly displays the item, current bid, and allows the player to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast', when a building auction involving the human player begins, then the game speed is temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The building shortage auction is a complex feature that correctly implements the official rule.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a player, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts or fund purchases.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own an undeveloped and unmortgaged property, when I confirm the 'Mortgage' action in the Property Management interface, then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value and the property becomes visually marked as mortgaged.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with one or more houses on it, when I view it in the Property Management interface, then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent lands on that space, then no rent transaction occurs and my cash balance remains unchanged.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is logged at INFO level. Integration with the rent collection system is verified.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Human Player, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a mortgaged property ('St. Charles Place', mortgage value $70), when I confirm the action to unmortgage it, then $77 ($70 + $7 interest) is deducted from my cash and the property's status is updated to 'unmortgaged'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property but have insufficient funds to cover the unmortgage cost plus interest, when I view the property in the management UI, then the 'Unmortgage' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have successfully unmortgaged a property, when an opponent lands on it later in the game, then rent is collected as normal.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The transaction is atomic, logged, and correctly persisted in a save file.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
description: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface and construct a trade offer so that I can strategically negotiate to acquire properties to complete monopolies.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, when I open the trade interface, select an AI, construct an offer, and click 'Propose Trade', then the proposal is submitted to the AI's decision-making module.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property that has houses on it, when I open the trade interface, then that property is not available for selection in the trade UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI opponent's turn, when I view the game, then the UI button to initiate a trade is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The trading interface is intuitive and enforces all trading rules.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear dialog when an AI proposes a trade so that I can evaluate the deal and decide to accept or decline it.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent proposes a trade, when the offer is presented, then the game flow is paused and a modal dialog displays the offered/requested assets and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Accept' button, then the system validates the trade, exchanges the assets atomically, and the game flow resumes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Decline' button, then the dialog closes, no assets are exchanged, and the game flow resumes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The trade transaction is atomic and updates the GameState correctly.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a strategic player, I want to respond to an AI's trade proposal with a modified counter-offer so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my goals.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has proposed a trade, when I click the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button, then the main two-panel trading UI opens, pre-populated with the AI's original offer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have opened the counter-offer UI and modified the trade, when I submit the counter-offer, then the AI's evaluation logic is triggered and it responds with an acceptance or rejection.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have opened the counter-offer UI, when I click the 'Cancel' button without submitting, then the UI closes and the original trade is considered declined.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The UI flow is intuitive and state management is robust.

title: Receive notification of AI-to-AI trades
description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when AI 1 successfully completes a trade with AI 2, then a non-intrusive notification banner appears on the screen summarizing the trade.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a complex trade occurs between two AIs, when the notification appears, then it provides a concise summary, e.g., 'Trade Complete: AI 1 traded 2 properties to AI 2 for 1 property and $100'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant', when two AIs complete a trade, then the trade notification is still displayed for its full, standard duration.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The notification is non-intrusive and does not pause gameplay.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the rules are enforced fairly and automatically.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns an undeveloped 'Baltic Avenue', when Player B lands on it, then the base rent is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns the undeveloped monopoly for the purple properties, when Player B lands on one, then double the base rent is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns a mortgaged 'Indiana Avenue', when Player B lands on it, then no rent is collected.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The rent calculation is 100% accurate to the official rules for all property types and states.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an opponent's property with houses and can afford rent, when my movement ends, then my cash is automatically reduced by the correct rent amount, the owner's cash increases, and a notification confirms the payment.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on an opponent's mortgaged property, when my movement ends, then no rent is charged and my cash remains unchanged.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have $50 cash and land on an opponent's property where rent is $100, when the rent payment is triggered, then the system identifies I cannot pay and initiates the bankruptcy process.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The rent payment is atomic and integrates correctly with the bankruptcy system.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen so that my achievement is acknowledged.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the last AI opponent is declared bankrupt, when the win condition is met, then the main game view is replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when I view it, then it shows a 'Victory!' message, my profile name, and key stats like Final Net Worth and Game Duration.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when it first appears, then a victory fanfare audio clip plays and celebratory visual effects are rendered.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The win condition correctly triggers the screen and subsequent update to the Top Scores list.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt so that I understand I have lost the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, when they are declared bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen with more than one AI opponent remaining, when the player clicks 'View Game Summary', then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player is bankrupt, when the AI simulation concludes with a single winner, then the game automatically transitions to the final 'Game Summary' screen.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The high-speed AI simulation functions correctly and does not cause performance issues.

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has concluded, when the Game Summary screen is displayed, then it prominently indicates the winner and shows a statistics section for all players who participated.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when the user reviews the stats, then the values for 'Final Net Worth', 'Total Rent Collected', and 'Properties Owned' accurately reflect the final game state.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is viewing the summary screen, when they click the 'Return to Main Menu' button, then the application navigates back to the main menu.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The UI layout adapts correctly to 2, 3, and 4-player games.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player so that I can instantly assess the state of the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new 4-player game has started, when the main game board is loaded, then a HUD is visible with four panels, each correctly displaying a player's name, token icon, and starting cash of $1500.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a game is in progress, when the turn advances from Player 1 to Player 2, then the visual highlight on Player 1's HUD panel is removed and applied to Player 2's panel.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's cash balance is $1000, when they pass GO and collect $200, then their cash display in the HUD immediately updates to show $1200.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The HUD scales correctly on all supported aspect ratios and updates in real-time.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what and make faster strategic decisions.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a property is unowned, when a player purchases it, then a visual indicator corresponding to the purchasing player's color immediately appears on that property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player owns a property, when the player mortgages it, then the ownership indicator's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes greyed-out).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns Property X, when Player A and Player B complete a trade exchanging properties, then the marker on Property X immediately updates to show Player B's ownership.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The visual state of the board is always an accurate reflection of the GameState object.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused pop-up for critical decisions so that I can consciously evaluate my options without missing important events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an unowned property, when my turn is active, then the game pauses and a modal dialog is displayed with 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI opponent proposes a trade, when the offer is presented, then a modal dialog is displayed with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any critical decision modal is active, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside the dialog, then the clicks are ignored and only interactions within the modal are registered.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. A generic, reusable modal system is created to handle all critical player decisions.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions from a single interface.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn before I have rolled the dice, when I click the 'Manage Properties' button, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own several properties, when I open the management interface, then all owned properties are listed and visually grouped by their color set, with mortgaged properties clearly marked.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a complete, undeveloped monopoly and have sufficient cash, when I select a property and click 'Build House', then my cash is debited and the property's state is updated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The interface provides access to all property actions and enforces all relevant game rules.

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct and review trade offers.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player initiates a trade, when the UI appears, then it displays two main panels, 'Your Offer' and 'Their Offer', showing available assets for selection.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds properties, cash, and cards to both panels, then all items appear correctly and the 'Propose Trade' button becomes enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade, when the offer is presented, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, with buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The UI is intuitive, enforces all trading rules (no developed properties, sufficient cash), and handles all three entry points (player-initiated, AI-initiated, counter-offer).

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit in a controlled manner.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when the player presses the 'Escape' key, then the game simulation is paused and a settings menu is displayed as an overlay.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the settings menu is open, when the player views it, then it contains distinct options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a modal dialog (e.g., a trade offer) is displayed, when the player opens the settings menu, then the settings menu is blocked or hidden until the modal dialog is resolved.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The pause/resume functionality is robust and does not corrupt the game state.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when they select the 'Fast' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations play at an accelerated rate.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the settings menu, when they select the 'Instant' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations are skipped or rendered almost instantaneously.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and a property auction involving the human player begins, when the auction starts, then the game speed is temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The setting persists in a saved game and is correctly restored on load.

title: Adjust master, music, and sound effect volumes independently
description: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has set custom volume levels, when the player closes and relaunches the game, then the audio levels are at their previously set values.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The settings are saved and persist across game sessions.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores so that I can have a clean slate.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click 'Reset All Player Data' and confirm the action, then all my stats are reset to their default zero state in the database.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have existing data, when I open the reset confirmation dialog and click 'Cancel', then no data is modified or deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the confirmation dialog appears, when I view it, then the text clearly states that the action is permanent and cannot be undone.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The database transaction is atomic and correctly scoped to the active player profile.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games
description: As a user, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user has at least one saved game, when they click 'Delete All Saved Games' and confirm, then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has no saved game files, when they navigate to the settings menu, then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user has opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when they click 'Cancel', then the dialog closes and no files are deleted.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The feature handles file system errors gracefully.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
description: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu, when they click the 'Tutorial' button, then the game transitions to a dedicated, scripted tutorial game state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the tutorial has started, when it prompts the player to roll the dice, then the 'Roll' button is highlighted and all other UI elements are non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has completed the final guided action, when the action is confirmed, then a 'Tutorial Complete' dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' or 'Return to Main Menu'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The tutorial is data-driven and covers all core mechanics.

title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in-game, when they open the pause menu and click 'Rulebook', then the rulebook UI is displayed as a modal overlay and the game is paused.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the rulebook UI is open, when the player types a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, then the list of rules is dynamically filtered to show only entries containing that keyword.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is launched, when the player opens the rulebook, then the content displayed is sourced from an external structured JSON data file.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The rulebook handles missing or corrupt data files gracefully.

title: Save my game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing later.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn before I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an empty slot, then the current GameState is serialized to a versioned JSON file in the saves directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file is overwritten with the new game state.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The save operation completes in under 2 seconds and includes a checksum for data integrity.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu so that I can seamlessly continue my progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen with a valid save, when I select the slot and confirm, then the game transitions to the gameplay scene and the entire game state is perfectly restored.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of slots is displayed, then each occupied slot displays the profile name, timestamp, and turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and a save file is corrupted, when the list is displayed, then the corresponding slot is marked as 'Corrupted' and the load action is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The load time is under 10 seconds on recommended hardware. The system handles corrupted and incompatible files gracefully.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
description: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear visual indication for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible so that I can avoid the frustration of attempting to load a broken save.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a save file exists whose content does not match its stored checksum, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that slot is visually distinct and labeled 'Corrupted'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a save file exists from an older, incompatible game version, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that slot is visually distinct and labeled 'Incompatible Version'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a save slot is marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Incompatible', when I attempt to interact with it, then the 'Load' button for that slot is disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The checksum and version validation logic is robust and prevents the application from crashing on malformed files.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has won 10 or more games, when they select 'Top Scores' from the main menu, then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted by Final Net Worth in descending order.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has not yet won a game, when they navigate to the 'Top Scores' screen, then a user-friendly message is displayed stating that no victories have been recorded yet.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the database contains two victories with the exact same net worth, when the player views the list, then the victory achieved in fewer turns is ranked higher.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The screen loads in under 500ms and correctly handles tie-breaking.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
description: As a competitive player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple text file so that I can easily share my achievements with friends or keep a personal record.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the 'Top Score History' screen, when they click 'Export to Text' and select a location in the 'Save As' dialog, then a .txt file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a high score file has been exported, when the user opens it, then the file contains a clear header and each score entry on a new line, matching the data shown in-game.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the high score list is empty, when the player views the 'Top Score History' screen, then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The feature handles file system errors gracefully and provides user feedback.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu, when they navigate to Settings, select the 'Futuristic' theme, and confirm, then the main menu's UI, background, and music immediately change to the 'Futuristic' theme.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in an active game, when they change the theme via the pause menu, then all in-game assets including the board, tokens, UI, and audio are updated to the new theme.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has selected the 'Futuristic' theme and closed the application, when they launch the game again, then the game starts up with the 'Futuristic' theme already active.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The game ships with at least two distinct, complete themes. Theme switching does not cause performance degradation.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified when a new version of the game is available upon startup so that I can easily access the latest features and bug fixes.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have an older game version and an internet connection, when I launch the application, then a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu indicating an update is available.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the update notification is displayed, when I click it, then my default web browser opens to the game's official download page.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I do not have an active internet connection or the version check server is unreachable, when I launch the application, then the version check fails silently and the game loads normally without any error message.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The version check is asynchronous, has a short timeout, and does not block the main menu from loading.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access a clear data privacy statement from the main menu so that I can understand how my data is handled and confirm the game operates offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu, when they click the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal view appears displaying the data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user reads the content, then the text explicitly confirms that the application operates entirely offline and all data is stored locally.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user clicks the 'Close' button, then the view is dismissed and the main menu becomes interactive again.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. All acceptance criteria are met. The privacy statement text is loaded from an external resource file, not hardcoded.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat') from the selection interface, then the 'Top Hat' token becomes visually highlighted, and any previously selected token is deselected.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with 3 AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup and started the game, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board is the 'Battleship' and the player's icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code reviewed and approved. A minimum of 8 token options are available. The selection is correctly reflected in-game. Art assets for all tokens are complete.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu and have at least one valid saved game file, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid slot, and confirm, then the game transitions to the gameplay scene and the entire game state is perfectly restored.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of save slots is displayed, then each occupied and valid slot must display the player's profile name, the date and time of the save, and the turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and at least one save file has failed its checksum validation, when the list of save slots is displayed, then the slot corresponding to the corrupted file is visually marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Unusable' and is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code reviewed and approved. The load time is under 10 seconds on recommended hardware. The system handles corrupted and incompatible files gracefully.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly and I can focus on my strategy.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns 'Baltic Avenue' (but not a monopoly) and it is not mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Baltic Avenue', then the base rent is automatically deducted from Player B's cash and added to Player A's cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns all properties of a color group (a monopoly) and they are undeveloped, when Player B lands on one of them, then double the base rent for that property is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns 'Indiana Avenue' and it is currently mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Indiana Avenue', then no rent is collected and no cash is transferred between players.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code for the rent calculation logic has been peer-reviewed against the official Monopoly rulebook. Unit test coverage for the rent module exceeds 85%. Integration with the bankruptcy system is verified.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance and feel a sense of long-term progression.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has completed at least one game, when the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, then a statistics screen is displayed showing correct values for Total games played, Total wins, Win/Loss ratio, etc.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., 'Total Games Played: 0', 'Win/Loss Ratio: N/A').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has existing statistics with 5 games played and 2 wins, when the player completes and wins a new game, then the 'Total Games Played' statistic displays '6' and 'Total Wins' displays '3'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The screen loads in under 1 second. The database backup and recovery mechanism is functional. All statistics are correctly updated upon game completion.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from the same point at a later time.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in an active game and it is the start of my turn (before rolling), when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, then the complete current GameState object is serialized into a versioned JSON file.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file for that slot is replaced with the new game state data.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The save operation completes in under 2 seconds and includes a checksum for data integrity. The save file format is documented.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game and am no longer an active participant.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, when the system's bankruptcy logic declares the player bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the 'Game Over' screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then it must contain a prominent header like 'Game Over' and a single call-to-action button labeled 'View Game Summary'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the human player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen and more than one AI opponent remains, when the player clicks 'View Game Summary', then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins until a single AI winner is determined.
column14: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The high-speed AI simulation is verified to complete correctly and without performance degradation. The screen correctly transitions to the Game Summary screen.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate and start tracking my performance from scratch.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button and 'Confirm' on the subsequent dialog, then all my historical stats are reset to their default zero state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have existing data, when I open the reset confirmation dialog and click 'Cancel', then no data is modified or deleted, and the settings menu remains active.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the confirmation dialog appears, when I view it, then the text clearly states that the action is permanent and cannot be undone.
column14: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The database transaction is atomic and correctly scoped to the active player profile. The UI is clear and prevents accidental data loss.

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct, review, and understand trade offers to make strategic decisions effectively.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player initiates a trade with an AI, when the interface appears, then it displays two main panels: 'Your Offer' and 'Their Offer', showing available assets for selection.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds properties, cash, and cards to both panels, then all items appear correctly and the 'Propose Trade' button becomes enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade, when the offer is presented, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, with buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The UI is intuitive, enforces all trading rules (no developed properties, sufficient cash), and handles all three entry points (player-initiated, AI-initiated, counter-offer).

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player managing my in-game assets, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single, consolidated interface.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn, before they have rolled the dice, when the player clicks the 'Manage Properties' button in the main HUD, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player owns several properties, when the player opens the property management interface, then all owned properties are listed and visually grouped by their color set, with mortgaged properties clearly marked.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player owns a complete, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when the player selects a property and clicks the 'Build House' button, then the player's cash is debited by the correct building cost and the UI updates immediately.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code reviewed and approved. The interface provides access to all property actions (build, sell, mortgage, unmortgage, trade) and enforces all relevant game rules. UI is intuitive and performant.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game in a controlled manner.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress and it is the human player's turn, when the player presses the 'Escape' key, then the game simulation is paused and a settings menu is displayed as an overlay.
